events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on highway 40 with minor injuries and vehicle damage.
The claim has been categorized as an Auto Accident based on the description of vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim for efficient processing.
The claimant was informed that the insurance company has received the claim and will begin review shortly.
Request sent for police accident report, driverâ€™s license, and vehicle registration to verify claim details.
Customer submitted the requested police report, license copy, and photographs of the damaged vehicle promptly.
Investigation into the circumstances of the vehicle collision has commenced with review of evidence.
Investigation completed confirming liability and verifying the extent of damage to the vehicle.
A settlement amount has been proposed based on repair estimates and policy coverage limits.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the fair settlement proposal and timely communication.
The claim was approved for the full proposed settlement amount following customer consent.
Insurance payment was issued electronically to cover vehicle repair costs in full.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after payment was confirmed and accepted.
Claim documents and correspondence were archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
